result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

08:33 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: Joel Kenneth Larimore, DF: David J, Pointer appeared via zoom. Court reviews case. Atty Larimore states case is not settled and request trial. ADA Rockow states once JT is set the lab will then produce lab results. Court sets 2 day JT. All MIL due by November 7th, 2022. Adjourned 08:39 AM  Jury trial scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:46 AM  CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: K Kittel.   ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore and  DF:  David J, Pointer both appeared by zoom. Atty Rockow notes all discovery has been sent. Atty Larimore will not be filing any motions, matter has not resolved, however, Attys feel it should resolve. Court confirms address and phone of DE. Adjourned: 9:53 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Status conference on May 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.

03:21 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: Joel Kenneth Larimore, DF: David J, Pointer appeared. Court reviews case. Atty Larimore states DE to waive PH. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for ARGN. ARGN: Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Atty Larimore pleads NG on DE behalf. Waives Speedy Trial. Court sets STC. Court confirms address and phone number. ADA Rockow addresses Bond. Court continues suspension of testing. Adjourned 03:30 PM  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 13, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

09:31 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: Joel Kenneth Larimore appeared via zoom, DF: David J, Pointer appeared via zoom. Court reviews case. ADA Rockow states seeing proof of medical THC card (provided) would agree to remove testing requirement. Court would like to see rules and regulations of participating in medical thc in the state of MN. Court suspends testing until04/13/22. Court does not modify bond at this time. Atty Larimore waives prelim time limits. Court sets PH. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 09:50 AM  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on April 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

02:02 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: Joel Kenneth Larimore, DF: David J, Pointer appeared. Court reviews case. Atty Larimore updates Court on current medications prescribed. ADA Rockow notes DE would be in violation on bond as the way the bond reads currently. Atty Larimore bond arguments. Court Denies bond modification at this time. Court sets BBH. Atty Rockow requests to suspend testing until further notice. Court suspends testing unitl 04/05/22. DE updates Address. Court confirms phone number. Adjourned 02:14 PM  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Preliminary hearing on April 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

- Defendant to test today. Baseline.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

-  I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing at least 1 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

01:10 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Joel Kenneth Larimore, DF: David J. Pointer appeared. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. DE has obtained private counsel. Bond arguments. Atty Larimore wavies prelim time limits. Court orders bond. Court sets PH. Adjourned  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
